 Advanced Manufacturing Engineering


Projected outlook for some certified Advanced Manufacturing Engineering (AME) experts:



292,000Number of Jobs, 2020




$95,300Median Pay per year, 2021




14%Job Growth, 2020-2030



		                            *U.S. Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics, Occupational Outlook Handbook – Industrial Engineers
	



Learn state-of-the art manufacturing engineering technologies 
The Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate Program offers rich occupational experience.

	                            This certificate program is designed to introduce the principles of advanced manufacturing technologies, while enabling participants to experience rich occupational experience and continued skills improvement. Earning the Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate will enhance the competitiveness, technical knowledge, and resulting working efficiency of the program graduates.


	                            Our Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate program is taught by Instructor Sagil James, Ph.D., Associate Professor, Department of Mechanical Engineering, California State University, Fullerton.




 Lunch and Learn 


			       Explore and experience with us the latest developments and recent trends in the exciting world of Biomanufacturing and 3D Bioprinting technologies. You can meet with industry and academic experts to discuss numerous jobs and career opportunities.
		

Date: October 7, 2022 Time: 11am - 1:30pm


Register Now





Dr. Sagil James

		                            Lead Instructor for Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate Program California State University, Fullerton
	
Read Interview Read Bio


Digital Badge

   Earn additional digital badges by taking these elective courses    Earn additional digital badges by taking these elective courses 


		                            Showcase your professional accomplishments with digital badges from CSUF Extension & International Programs! A digital badge is a visual representation of skills and knowledge you have gained by completing a certificate program or course. Display these highly coveted credentials on your resume, online portfolio, website, LinkedIn and other social media pages.
	

		                            After completing the Advanced Manufacturing Engineering program or elective, you will receive an email with instructions on how to receive your digital badge through the Badgr platform. From there, you can create an account where you will be able to display all the badges you've earned digitally. Though the digital badge does not count as academic credit, these highly coveted digital badges can be placed on your résumé and on LinkedIn or other social media platforms.



You Will:

Earn a fundamental understanding of various advanced manufacturing processes and their underlying principles.
Gain the ability to understand and apply various technologies and practices of industrial automation, smart manufacturing, and other emerging manufacturing technologies.
Obtain an understanding of modeling, analysis, and optimization of various manufacturing processes.
Have the ability to apply knowledge, techniques, skills and modern tools of engineering to solve real-world problems in manufacturing industries.



Ideal for:

Community and technical college graduates looking for high-technology/high-paying manufacturing jobs.
Domestic/international undergraduate students seeking a manufacturing career-oriented certificate program.
Fresh university graduates seeking specific job training and skills for a manufacturing career.
Young professional engineers seeking a career-boosting certificate to increase the potential for a higher salary.
Manufacturing organizations that wish to provide customized manufacturing training to their employees and associates.





Electives: 

Advanced Quality Engineering

Online, 10 hours /1 CEU 
Prerequisite: None. Participants should be familiar with probability and statistics for engineers
		
Learn More Register


Product Development Engineering

Online, 10 hours /1 CEU 
Prerequisite: None. Participants should be familiar with Computer-Aided Design (CAD)
		
Learn More Register






x
Meet Dr. Sagil James

					                            Dr. James is currently working as an Associate Professor in Mechanical Engineering at California State University, Fullerton. He received his master’s and Ph.D. degrees in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Cincinnati. His primary research areas are Advanced Manufacturing, Smart Manufacturing, and Process Modeling and Simulation. Dr. James brings in more than 15 years of combined academic research and industry experience in the manufacturing field to his role as the lead instructor for the Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate Program (AMEC) at California State University, Fullerton.                                       
					









x
Advanced Quality Engineering

					                            This course introduces the basic concepts of quality engineering. It covers various traditional and advanced quality-related programs that have been widely used throughout the design and manufacturing industries. Specifically, it focuses on statistical process control, six sigma, inspection techniques, sampling, automated inspection, metrology, Coordinate Measuring Machines, Optical, Non-optical inspection techniques, etc.
				








x
Product Development Engineering

					                            This course covers various topics in industrial production systems including process planning, integration of product design and manufacturing and other functions through concurrent engineering, Design for Manufacturing (DFM), methods used to implement production planning and control, through material requirements planning, shop floor control, and enterprise resource planning (ERP).
				








				For optimal viewing of the course schedule below, please view on a tablet or desktop

 After the completion of this Advanced Manufacturing Engineering Certificate program, the students will obtain the following learning outcomes: a)     A fundamental understanding of various advanced manufacturing processes and the principles that underlie them.b)     An ability to understand and apply various technologies and practices of industrial automation, smart manufacturing, and other emerging manufacturing technologies.c)     An understanding of modeling, analysis, and optimization of various manufacturing processes.d)     An ability to apply knowledge, techniques, skills and modern tools of engineering to solve real-world problems in manufacturing industries.e)     Develop effective skills in professional engineering communication and organization. 
 


 1.     Junior college, community college, and technical college graduates looking for high-technology/high-paying manufacturing jobs2.     Domestic/international undergraduate students seeking manufacturing career-oriented certificate program3.     Fresh university graduates seeking specific job training and skills for manufacturing career4.     Young professional engineers seeking career-boosting certification and increase the potential for a higher salary5.     Manufacturing industries that wish to provide customized manufacturing training to their employees and associates 
 


 The program is open to all junior college students, current undergraduate students, graduate students, and eligible employees identified or recommended by their hosting organization or corporation. In order to ensure that students in a course possess the required knowledge and skills and in order to maintain high-quality courses/programs.It is recommended that participants who reside outside of United States and whose first language is not English possess English language proficiency equivalent to:A minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper) or 80 (iBT) Or A minimum IELTS score of 6.5. There is no need to send the test score to the University. It the participant's responsibility to demonstrate English language proficiency necessary to fully participate in the class lectures and discussions. 
 




 










		                                                                                                                                                         Program Details
	

Location: Online, Weekly modules
Length: 4 months
Cost: $1,900*
Next Start: September 2023


*Cost is approximate and subject to change
